title: Frozen Research Vault Adventure #14
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Cryogenic Storage Chamber
rooms.description: A frigid chamber filled with rows of frosted cryogenic pods. Ice crystals coat every surface, and your breath forms clouds in the subzero air. Emergency lighting casts an eerie blue glow. The temperature gauge on the wall reads negative forty degrees. A control station sits near the entrance, and several pods line the walls.

items.name: cryo control station
items.description: A computer terminal with frost-covered screens and a locked drawer underneath

items.name: research log datapad
items.description: A digital tablet with research notes and facility information
items.text: Research Log: Specimen Alpha 7 stored in pod 21. Specimen Beta 5 in pod 57. Critical: Facility lockdown code is the pod numbers in sequence. Lead researcher is Dr. Helena Frost. All specimens must remain at cryogenic temperatures.

items.name: security access keycard
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled 'Level 2 Access' with frost clinging to its edges

items.name: cryogenic pod Alpha 7
items.description: A large cylindrical pod with a viewing window showing a preserved specimen inside
items.text: Pod Label: Specimen Alpha 7 - Status: Stable. Temperature: -196°C. Do not thaw.

items.name: emergency supply locker
items.description: A metal locker containing emergency equipment and supplies

items.name: handheld thermal scanner
items.description: A device for measuring temperature and detecting heat signatures

items.name: facility layout map
items.description: A laminated map showing the research vault's layout
items.text: Map shows: Cryo Storage (current location) connects to Main Research Lab via the north corridor. Emergency Exit is accessible from the Research Lab. Note: Dr. Frost's office contains backup security protocols.

items.name: specimen storage cabinet
items.description: A tall cabinet with glass doors, containing various research samples

items.name: specimen documentation
items.description: Papers detailing the research specimens and their storage
items.text: Specimen Documentation: All samples collected from Arctic expedition. Primary researcher: Dr. Helena Frost. Storage protocol requires maintaining vault integrity. Emergency evacuation route leads to the surface bunker.

items.name: reinforced airlock door
items.description: A heavy door with a card reader and frost buildup around the seal

rooms.name: Main Research Laboratory
rooms.description: A spacious laboratory filled with scientific equipment, computer workstations, and analysis machines. Frost patterns decorate the windows. Research papers and specimen containers are scattered across the workbenches. A large information panel is mounted on the wall, and a secure vault door dominates the far wall.

items.name: research workbench
items.description: A long table covered with microscopes, test tubes, and research equipment

items.name: laboratory notebook
items.description: A notebook filled with handwritten research observations
items.text: Lab Notes: Breakthrough discovery in specimen analysis! The key to understanding the samples lies in their origin. All specimens were collected from the Arctic surface bunker location. Temperature stability is critical for preservation.

items.name: research computer terminal
items.description: A desktop computer with multiple monitors displaying data and graphs
items.text: Computer Display: Research Database - Lead Researcher: Dr. Helena Frost. Project Status: Active. Security Level: Maximum. Warning: Unauthorized access will trigger lockdown protocols.

items.name: wall mounted information panel
items.description: A digital display panel showing facility information and emergency procedures
items.text: Emergency Procedures: In case of facility breach, proceed to Emergency Vault. Access requires knowledge of: Lead researcher name, specimen origin location, and evacuation destination. Contact Dr. Helena Frost for authorization.

items.name: secure filing system
items.description: A cabinet with multiple compartments for storing classified documents

items.name: security memorandum
items.description: An official document outlining security protocols
items.text: SECURITY MEMO: Emergency vault access requires verification. Personnel must correctly answer security questions. Remember: specimens came from Arctic surface bunker, evacuation leads to surface bunker, lead researcher is Dr. Helena Frost.

items.name: specimen freezer unit
items.description: A large freezer containing preserved research samples

items.name: preserved specimen sample
items.description: A small container holding a frozen biological sample

items.name: emergency vault door
items.description: A massive reinforced door with a security terminal displaying three verification questions

password_questions.question: Who is the lead researcher?
password_questions.hint: Check the research logs and computer terminal

password_questions.question: Where were the specimens collected?
password_questions.hint: Look at the lab notebook and security memo

password_questions.question: Where does the evacuation route lead?
password_questions.hint: The facility map and security memo mention the evacuation destination

rooms.name: Emergency Escape Corridor
rooms.description: You've made it to the emergency escape route! A long corridor with emergency lighting leads upward. At the end, a ladder ascends to a surface hatch. Through the small window in the hatch, you can see daylight and freedom. The temperature is rising as you move away from the frozen vault below.

items.name: escape ladder
items.description: A sturdy metal ladder leading up to the surface hatch and freedom

items.name: surface access hatch
items.description: A hatch leading to the outside world, with sunlight visible through its window

items.name: emergency supply cache
items.description: A box containing survival gear, food, and communication equipment

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've navigated through the frozen research vault, solved all the security puzzles, and reached the emergency escape corridor. You climb the ladder and push open the surface hatch, emerging into the bright Arctic daylight. The frozen vault and its secrets remain below as you make your way to safety. You win!
